our_mission_text: Our mission is to provide personal and high-quality service by valuing honesty and orderliness. We provide security for our partners as well as opportunities for self-fulfilment for good employees.
our_vision_text: Our vision is to be the best workforce outsourcing company in the HORECA and food industry sectors in Northern Europe.
agree_data: I agree to the processing of my personal data
faq_q1: How can I apply for a job?
faq_a1: You can choose a vacancy from the list and fill out the application form. After submitting, our team will contact you.
faq_q2: Do I need to know the language to get a job?
faq_a2: Not always. Some jobs require no language skills, while for others basic knowledge is recommended.
faq_q3: Do you only help with official employment?
faq_a3: Yes, we assist only with official jobs that provide contracts and necessary documentation.
faq_a4: In some cases, yes. If accommodation is available, it will be mentioned in the vacancy description.
faq_q5: What happens after I submit my CV?
faq_a5: Our recruiter will review your application and contact you for further steps.
error_privacy: Could not open Privacy Policy link.
confirmation_message: Thank you for applying. We will contact you soon.
how_step1_sub: Check out the latest jobs and find your perfect match!
how_step2_sub: Check important info: salary, hours, and job description.
how_step3_sub: Fill out a simple application form directly in the app.
how_step4_sub: You will receive a message that your application has been successfully submitted.
doc_idcard: The Estonian ID card is a mandatory document for all residents. It serves as an official form of identification and allows access to e-services, including digital signatures, tax declarations, and medical portals. Foreigners residing in Estonia for more than 3 months must apply for an ID card at the Police and Border Guard Board.
doc_residence: If you are a non-EU citizen and plan to stay in Estonia for longer than 90 days, you must apply for a residence permit. This requires a work contract or proof of sufficient financial means. Applications are submitted at the PBGB or Estonian embassies.
doc_health: Health insurance is mandatory in Estonia. Most employees are covered through the Estonian Health Insurance Fund (Haigekassa). Freelancers and self-employed must apply separately. Emergency care is provided regardless of insurance status.
doc_sickleave_title: How to Get a Sick Leave
doc_sickleave: To receive paid sick leave, contact your family doctor who will open a digital sick leave certificate in the e-Health system. The first three days are unpaid, and from day 4 onward, compensation is provided.
doc_visa: A type D visa allows you to work in Estonia for up to 365 days. Apply at an embassy or at the PBGB. You need a valid passport, work contract, photo, proof of insurance and fee payment. After arriving, you must register your place of residence and apply for a residence permit if needed.
doc_tax: Annual tax declarations are submitted online at emta.ee. The deadline is April 30. Residents must declare worldwide income. The system often pre-fills data, and refunds are transferred directly to bank accounts.
doc_passport_photo: Passport photos must meet strict ICAO standards. Size: 35x45mm, recent (less than 6 months), light background, no shadows, neutral expression. Avoid glasses, head coverings (unless religious), and heavy makeup.
